author: bobbytreed
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
New-Alias
```

```output
New-Alias: The 'New-Alias' command was found in the module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'.
```

```powershell
import-module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility
```

```output
Import-Module: Failed to generate proxies for remote module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'. The 'Export-PSSession' command was found in the module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'.
```

```none
PS>New-Alias
New-Alias: The 'New-Alias' command was found in the module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'.
PS>import-module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility
Import-Module: Failed to generate proxies for remote module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'. The 'Export-PSSession' command was found in the module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility', but the module could not be loaded. For more information, run 'Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'.
```

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
Using 7.0.0, I can't duplicate this error.

Here is what I see:
```powershell
PS C:\foo> New-Alias

cmdlet New-Alias at command pipeline position 1
Supply values for the following parameters:
Name:
```

comments.author: bobbytreed
comments.body:
It was an issue with PSModulePath.  Something put in Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\Modules into the PSModulePath.  I'm guessing when 7 tried to load utility it loaded 5.1 utility instead and blew up. Fun troubleshooting though.  Now need to find root cause.

Thanks!

title: Import-Module: Failed to generate proxies for remote module 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility'
